description: Values of p+6 such that p and p+6 are both prime.
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Sexy Primes.
mathematica: q=6; a={}; Do[p1=Prime[n]; p2=p1+q; If[PrimeQ[p2], AppendTo[a, p2]], {n, 7^2}]; a "and/or" Select[Prime[Range[3, 7^2]], PrimeQ[ # ]&&PrimeQ[ #-6]&] (* _Vladimir Joseph Stephan Orlovsky_, Aug 07 2008 *)
author: _Eric W. Weisstein_
